definition: waistband of a skirt/(fig.) related to the wife or another female family member
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
favoritism shown to sb because of the influence of the person's wife or other female relative/(by extension) favoritism towards relatives, friends or associates
the practice of favoring sb because of the influence of the person's wife or other female relative/(by extension) culture of favoritism towards relatives, friends and associates
official who gained his position through the influence of a female relative

pinyin: qun2 dai4 zi1 ben3 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Cage changed his name to deflect accusations of nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 凯奇改了名字以避免别人指责他搞裙带关系。

sentences.english: It's hard to avoid suspicions of nepotism about the program's management team.
sentences.chinese: 很难让人不去怀疑这个项目的运作中存在裙带关系。

sentences.english: Wakame is usually sold in stores in dried form.
sentences.chinese: 裙带菜通常以干燥的形式在商店出售。
新教徒之间的裙带关系是与生俱来的。

sentences.english: The mayor leaned over backward to avoid the appearance of nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 市长为了避免裙带关系的出现而走向了另一个极端。

sentences.english: "Crony capitalism has grown up in Egypt, particularly in the past decade," says Michael Hanna, who is in Cairo for the U.S.-based Century Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 埃及滋生的是裙带资本主义，特别是过去的十年里。

sentences.english: In this report we conclude about pharmacological activity of Undaria Pinnatifida.
sentences.chinese: 本文对裙带菜的药理作用研究行了总结。

sentences.english: That looked like just the sort of nepotism that the president abhors.
sentences.chinese: 而这正是总统深恶痛绝的裙带关系。

sentences.english: The congressman lashed the president for his nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 国会议员抨击总统搞裙带关系。

sentences.english: Snow in her elegant velvet-like rabbit jumped forward to jumping under the nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 雪绒似的玉兔在她飘逸的裙带下蹦着跳着。

sentences.english: After all, rewarding people according to merit is superior to corruption or nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，基于业绩给与奖励要优于腐败和裙带关系。

sentences.english: In Central Asia the most successful companies are sinecures of nepotism.
sentences.chinese: 而在中亚，最成功的公司往往是靠裙带关系。

sentences.english: The corruption, nepotism, favoritism, moneyembezzlement, all and all will fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 腐败，裙带关系，徇私枉法以及贪污都将土崩瓦解。

definition: old feminine garment, covering chest and abdomen
